dt: {bc}a colorless pungent liquid acid C{inf}2{/inf}H{inf}4{/inf}O{inf}2{/inf} that is the chief acid of vinegar and that is used especially in synthesis (as of plastics)

et: {it}acetic{/it} borrowed from French {it}acétique,{/it} from Latin {it}acētum{/it} "sour wine, vinegar" (noun derivative from {it}*acētus,{/it} verbal adjective of {it}acēre{/it} "to be sour," going back to Indo-European {it}h{inf}2{/inf}eḱ-eh{inf}1{/inf}-{/it} "to be sharp") + French {it}-ique{/it} {et_link|-ic:1|-ic:1} {ma}{mat|edge:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: a colorless pungent liquid acid C2H4O2 that is the chief acid of vinegar and that is used especially in synthesis (as of plastics)

dt: {bc}a colorless liquid C{inf}4{/inf}H{inf}6{/inf}O{inf}3{/inf} with a pungent odor used in organic synthesis (as of cellulose acetate and aspirin)

shortdef: a colorless liquid C4H6O3 with a pungent odor used in organic synthesis (as of cellulose acetate and aspirin)
